text: The 1000 metres event at the 1922 Women's World Games took place in Paris at the Stade Pershing on 20 August 1922. Four athletes from three nations participated in the 1000 metres. The race took place during the the afternoon session. British Lucie Bréard won the final in a time of 3:12.0 that was a new world record, ahead of the French Georgette Lenoir and British . During the race three other world records were broken. Bréard also broke the 500 metres world record, with a time of 1:29.2. Lenoir broke the 800 metres world record with a time of 2:30.4 and the half mile (806.6 meter) world record with a time of 2:31.2. ==Results== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes Lucie Bréard 3:12.0 WR Georgette Lenoir 3:12.2 4 Lucile Godbold Source: ===World records broken=== Record Time Name Nationality 500 metres 1:29.2 Lucie Bréard 800 metres 2:30.4 Georgette Lenoir half mile 2:31.2 Georgette Lenoir 1000 metres 3:12.0 Lucie Bréard Source: ==References== Category:1922 Women's World Games
